Description: Body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild goat style pottery plate; pale slip; interior, from outside: part of narrow black band with superimposed band in added white; part of frieze with two pinwheel rosettes separated by six alternating black and added red petals; wide black band with added white and red bands; exterior: traces of wide black band and one band in added white.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ200? (?)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Modern inscription in pencil records Context AΠ.00 and 200 (Previously read 'A17 cc zoo?'). The 200 was written out again as unclear. Joins British Museum 1886,0401.1014.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 35, pl. XXII, no. 6a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.715)
